data.title: My Mother Had Two Faces: Reflections on Beauty, Aging, and Acceptance — Karin Trachtenberg
data.meta_description: An autobiographical one-woman dramatic comedy that dares to expose what lies beneath the mask of the perfect mother. Is Karin, the heroine, living a fairy tale or nightmare as she stumbles upon her mother’s diaries after her death and begins to examine the history of their complicated relationship f
data.text:
Writer & Performer

Karin was born and raised on the island of Manhattan and has dual US-Swiss citizenship. She lives in Boston and has appeared in professional theatres throughout the U.S. and Europe performing major roles in Greek Drama and Shakespeare productions. Her film/tv and commercial credits include Showtime, NBC, and numerous industrials, web series and independent films. As an actor, director and producer, Karin has championed countless new plays from staged readings to full productions. She is particularly interested in creating more opportunities for women-centered storytelling which fosters healthy dialogue about difficult issues. This led her to make her film directorial debut, garnering awards throughout the film festival circuit.

Karin traveled to Greece for an experience of a lifetime performing the titular role in Euripides’ Phaedra at the Hydrama Theatre and Arts Center. It was there that she was determined to write her own one-woman show. Her first foray into writing, She found her way to the Soaring Solo community under the tutelage of Jessica Lynn Johnson.

Director & Developer

Jessica is a published playwright, recipient of BEST NATIONAL SOLO ARTIST AWARD, Advisory Board Member of the LA Women's Theatre Festival, Co-Executive Producer of both the Stars Solo Series and the Joshua Tree Solo Theatre Festival, and Founder & CEO of Soaring Solo Studios International. Jessica has aided in the development, direction and producing of over 150 solo shows (and still going strong)! As a performer, Jessica has “edutained” international audiences touring her own one person shows ZE and OBLIVIOUS TO EVERYONE for over 15 years.

Jessica's projects have taken home awards such as TOP OF FRINGE, HFF ENCORE PRODUCER AWARDS, TVOLUTION BEST SOLO PERFORMANCE, LARRY CORNWALL AWARD FOR MUSICAL EXCELLENCE & several other accolades! Jessica was also nominated for the Female Director of Distinction in Theatre by Girl Trip LLC at the 2018 Hollywood Fringe Festival. Jessica is so honored to collaborate with Karin on this impactful solo show! For more information please visit: www.SoaringSoloStudios.com

Mask Maker

Award-winning artist Eric Bornstein of Behind the Mask Studio/Theatre studied mask making with masters Agung Suardana in Bali, and Donato Sartori in Italy. He received his MLA in Fine Arts (Art History) along with the Thomas Small prize from Harvard University. Eric was awarded a Fulbright award to revive and reinvigorate the art of giant puppet effigies in Jamaica 2017. Over the last 30 years Eric’s masked characters have been the subject of numerous media features. Local and national media have described Eric as “Boston’s preeminent mask maker…a man of many talents,” and his masks as “phantasmagoric, magnificent, stunning, finely crafted, first-rate, eerie/enchanting, masterful, outstanding, and gorgeous.”

Behind the mask creations were a highlight of Boston’s First Night celebration for 15 years, as well as productions of Boston and Ft Wayne Ballets’ Nutcracker, Sugarloaf Ballet’s Beauty and the Beast, and Boston Lyric Opera’s Madame Butterfly. His masks have also appeared at the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, the Fuller Craft Museum, the Kennedy Library/Museum, the Society of Arts & Crafts (Newbury Street), and The Peabody/Essex Museum.

For more information please visit www.behindthemask.org or https://www.facebook.com/behindthemask1

Composer & Sound design

Bobby Raps is a Film and Video Game composer born and based in Boston, MA. He specializes in composition with virtual instruments, sound design, electric and classical guitar, and implementation of interactive music in video games. At the age of 15, he found his passion for music taking electric guitar lessons, and soon he was performing covers and original songs at local venues. He graduated Cum Laude from Berklee College of music where he studied with professors Duncan Watt, David Tronzo, Claudio Ragazzi, and Sheldon Mirowitz. Bobby is always searching for a unique emotional texture to bring out through his music, while also doing justice to the tender humanity that lies beneath all art. No matter the material, whether it be war, romance, victory or tragedy, Bobby is determined to find the common thread that connects all subjects and all people.

For more info visit: https://www.bobbyrapsmusic.com/
